Reviews.Title: “Clean rooms, friendly staff, beautifully-designed interior”
Reviews.Author: chv8
Reviews.Content: Stayed here while on vacation. The hotel is accessible from the MTR. Also very convenient to go to via taxi. Lots of eating places nearby. The staff were very accommodating and friendly. It took about 15 minutes from the time I arrived to the time I was shown to my room. The lobby was beautifully decorated, which makes one wish the rooms had a little bit more art too. I had the standard room, which was quite roomy and comfortable. The bathroom was clean, except for some areas on the sink and bath, which had a bit of slime mold. Overall, I enjoyed my stay here and would stay here again, given the chance.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and basic lodging at the Wesley”
Reviews.Author: chinabased
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Wesley in May 2011 on a business trip. I was trying to stay close to the Island Shangri-la, the location of the conference I was attending. This hotel is close to Pacific Place in Central. It was a ten minute walk from the hotel to the Shangri-la. The lobby has been recently renovated, and has a boutique feel to it. Check in was quick and efficient. Service was responsive and attentive. Free wifi in the lobby. Rooms were cozy, but by HK standards, normal. Room was clean and fully acceptable for a two night business trip. Recommended for location and value.

Reviews.Title: “Accessible to Wan Chai Metro Station”
Reviews.Author: gyrase
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this Hotel because its walking distance to the Metro Station and Hong Kong Convention and Exhibition Center.Clean room though quite small, good service and security, polite staff.

Reviews.Title: “I will miss this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Franny2000
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Wesley many times over the years, nice hotel, nice rooms, good service, but Jan. 31, 2012 was their last day open...

Reviews.Title: “a carpet of dust on my bed”
Reviews.Author: innoboxsg
Reviews.Content: Wesley Hotel Hong Kong, truly disugusting hotel . i can accept dust around edge of walls but not a carpet of dust on the bed :(. i have stay in different hotels in Hong Kong and this is the worse experience i have encountered. HK$1200 a nite for this hotel is truly not worth it. First and last time i am staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Basic but nice”
Reviews.Author: Paula O
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for one night while transiting in Hong Kong. The hotel is in a good location, walking distance from many spots in Wanchai and very accesible if you are planning a night out in Lan Kwai Fong. The rooms are basic, but very clean and spacious.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay with just a few items to work on :)”
Reviews.Author: jovanpuyo
Reviews.Content: We had to go to Hong Kong in December to attend a wedding of our friend. For those of you who are unfamiliar, that's probably one of the worst times to go there because it's the peak season and hotel prices just go over the roof. We chose the Wesley because its rate was relatively cheaper and the reviews from other travelers who reviewed it was OK. Transportation If you're looking for the right location, this is a good candidate. The hotel is along Hennessy Road and three blocks away from the Wan Chai MTR station. You can also take the tram, a bus or even catch a cab (you need to walk a bit to Johnston Road in front of MediMart). You cal also ask the people from the lobby to get a hotel for you (I believe there's a surcharge though). Food There's no room service but you don't need it anyway. There's a McDonald's right across the hotel and a Yoshinoya a few buildings on your left when you exit the hotel from Hennessy. If you walk towards the MTR station, there's another McDonald's there plus a Fairwood restaurant at the opposite side of Hennessy. There are several convenience stores very near the place - Wellcome on Johnston, Kmart on the corner of Hennessy and Fenwick, and two 7-Elevens at the corner of Johnston and Fenwick, and at the end of Anton Street, respectively. Lobby The lobby looks nice, but as a few people who reviewed this place pointed out, it's a smokescreen. It's quite different from what the actual rooms look like. As for the lobby people, the ones I encountered during daytime aren't as warm as I wanted but they're OK. The Room The room is small compared to hotels in other countries, but for Hong Kong standards and with the price that we paid, it's roomy enough. The carpet is old and dirty. The table needs some paint and so do the walls. If you check my pictures, you'll see that it needs touch up. The TV is small. There are only a handful of English channels available and we can't seem to tune Star World properly. Yes, there is a view from the 18th floor if you enjoy seeing Hong Kong's dirty buildings. The Bathroom The bathroom is tiny. Only one person can fit at a time (unless one is taking a shower while the other one is taking a dump). There are molds on the bathroom tiles and the exhaust duct needs major cleaning. Sleeping The bed is OK but the pillows are not. You'll suffer from stiff neck because of their lack of support. The walls also seem to be a bit thin that you can hear doors opening and closing from the other rooms. Internet Our room/package had free internet BUT it's wired. Unless you have a USB ethernet adapter for your MacBook Air or iPad, you will need to go to the lobby of the hotel, where there is free wifi available. Overall, if you're not picky and you're OK with these, then the Wesley is a wonderful place to stay. Would I go back? Maybe.

Reviews.Title: “Low Cost hidden gem”
Reviews.Author: tgancayco
Reviews.Content: Great hotel! The rooms were impeccable, clean and great smelling. Upon checking in we were offered an updrade to an executive suite which was nice and spacious. The Wesley Hotel's location is superb, right between Admirality and Wanchai metro stations which makes it easy to reach tourist destinations as well as Kowloon Island or Central Ferry Station. For approx 80euros this hotel provided safety, security, good and clean rooms and right beside the financial district without paying Central rates. Would come back here again on the next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant enough”
Reviews.Author: EdwinOddy
Reviews.Content: I found this clean, comfortable, well maintained and free wi-fi was offered on the tariff I paid. Otherwise there is free wi-fi in the lobby. This hotel is five minutes walk from Wan Chai. Go to google maps and study it carefully. It will show you that you need to use exit BI when you leave the station. The hotel itself at the junction between Hennessey Road and Anton Street. The area around the hotel is vibrant and bustling with all kinds of restaurants, bars and mini-markets. You can eat Italian (and pick up wi-fi in Pizza Express) or find a kind of English tea room that will offer you pastries and Early Grey. There is a Macdonalds nearby where you will find children and students sitting doing their homework and not far away there is a kind of pub that serves Thai food. Spanish and Korean food can also be found. This a place from which it is easy to explore Hong Kong going to the ferry terminals or using the hop-on-hop-off bus to give an overview of history and heritage. I found the hotel through Bookings.com which irritated me by failing to make a surcharge clear. You may end up spending 10% more than Bookings.com indicates once you check in. But, to give the desk its due, the staff did warn me when I checked in that a surcharge would be payable - so they are not to blame. Indeed, they are honest since I left something in my room when I checked out. When I went back an hour later, the item had been put in a smart bag and attached to my left luggage.

Reviews.Title: “Love the stay!”
Reviews.Author: sawbear1608
Reviews.Content: Decided to book this hotel online as the price was rather reasonable, compared with many others! Location was not bad. The airport express free shuttle from central station stops at Empire hotel, which was a short walk to the Wesley Hotel. The front desk was polite and assisted me very quickly with my check in. My room was 1404, which I believe was upgraded. The room was not big but comfortable enough for 2. Food was easily accessible around the hotel , with a few convenience stoes near by. Also, it's a short walk to Pacific Place shopping mall! Stayed 3 nights there and thoroughly enjoyed the stay! Will stay there again, if the price is good!

Reviews.Title: “In Need of A Good Scrub.”
Reviews.Author: BrilloAido
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights in Late October. We arrived just off the plane early 10am, and knew that we may not be able to check-in until later. However, luckily, there was a room available and they kindly let us check in early. On entering our room for the first time, 3 things hit you.... 1) The room is small (though wasn't expecting much, as I've been to Tokyo, etc). 2) The carpet is filthy. 3) The fixtures & fittings are tired and the bathroom units are dirty (with mould). We asked for a different room, which they gave us on a different floor (18th). That was just as filthy, so I'm guessing all the standard rooms are like this. Another thing I disliked about the room, was the air-con was noisy, so I couldn't sleep with it on. The location of the hotel is very good. They provide free WiFi in the lobby. Didn't eat here, so can't comment on breakfast. If I were to return to Hong Kong again, I would be looking elsewhere for a room.

Reviews.Title: “if location matters”
Reviews.Author: TravelSam82
Reviews.Content: spent four nights in this hotel. roomsize was okay, but overall, the room didn't make a good impression on us. although seems like they clean the rooms, it doesn't make you feel in clean room (dirty carpet). the carpet in the room is old as the whole interior is. it did not make a too good impression on us. (the lobby makes you expect something else, since the entrance-hall is state of the art). free internet is only in the lobby-area. location is good since it is next to good night-life places. staff is very helpful and friendly (although very slow when it comes to check-out).

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location. Good value”
Reviews.Author: ashwinsid
Reviews.Content: I stayed at The Wesley, Wanchai for two weeks. Our room was on the 14th floor. View was nothing great except lot of skyscrapers and a construction site across the road. The staff are very friendly, especially the housekeeping team who would visit everyday and replace the sheets, top up coffee/tea for the coffee maker, tissues, toiletries. Very friendly! Since we are vegetarians, we did not try the in house restaurants but glanced at the menu. Felt it was moderately expensive. Rooms are clean, adequately sized, bathrooms are a bit cramped though, with barely enough standing space between the bathtub and the washbasin. There is a platform next to the windows (which of course you cannot open). You can sit on the platform and glance at the world going by outside. We had free broadband (because of long stay), but otherwise, in house broadband is quite expensive. Biggest selling point of this hotel is its location. Walking distance to more three metro stations, bus stop and tram stops within a minutes walk, plenty of restaurants (Indian, McDonalds, Cafe Habitu, Ebeneezers), wellcome grocery mart. If you are tourist and plan to travel a lot within Hong Kong for a week, this is an ideal hotel which will help in easy commuting. Will surely consider staying here again. I love Hong Kong!

Reviews.Title: “Conveniently Located and Reasonably Priced”
Reviews.Author: efzed
Reviews.Content: Having lived in Hong Kong previously my wife and I needed a hotel that offered us a clean room close to the central core of Hong Kong (Causeway Bay, Wanchai and Central). It is on the subway line with all the buses that you will need. The room was clean and small (rather typical by Hong Kong standards) but very acceptable.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Nice design, good sized rooms”
Reviews.Author: JohnA1970
Reviews.Content: I had stayed at The Wesley in Hong Kong 2 night in the first half of August. General comments NIce hotel about 10 years old, but fairly recently refurbished. The design is contemporary and the location is great, very close the ferry and entertainment area of Wanchai. Rooms I had stayed in a superior room category and not the standard. The size was very good for Hong Kong terms and functionality as expected from a 4* hotel, incl. wireless internet and a fridge (not a minibar, as the fridge was found empty). Don't expect a breathtaking few, however you can have this from Victoria Peak if you want. The advantage is that the rooms are very good sound isolated which is imporant in a city with so much traffic. Bathroom is fairly basic and the bed of medium comfort at max. F&B Very short description for Westerners- NOT EXISTING. Breakfast is only Asian style, not even continental breakfast is served. No Room Service, which leaves you with the plenty of restaurants, just outside the hotel (e.g. try the Thai place accross the side entrance of the hotel. not very friendly stuff but a good value for money, tasty meal.) Service Only Front Office, which was fine. Asian friendliness..... not at it's peak, however on an absolute exceptable level. Concierge was not impressive at all, unforutnately, which was very disappointing for me, being the first time in Hong Kong. Surrounding Areas Plenty of Restaurants, contemporary clubs and bars and of course, way to many "girly bars" with absolute annoying Filipinas trying to convince you to have drink in their place. As I did not go in, I cannot comment any further. However, what I had tried were a few of the life music place in the same area. Almost all the bands I had heard were from the Philippines, however not comparable with the caliber you hear in Manila. Therefore 1 out of 5 only :-( . Also, drinks are way too expensive for what you get, at least for my taste. ($7-8 for a cheap, but not bad San Mig light, beer from the Philippines) Having had the same a few days earlier for as little as $1....... you can appreciate where I come from. Hope the review helps and as usual my final verdict - Good value for money, Good location, Would stay there again!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hospitality and Guest Care”
Reviews.Author: univall
Reviews.Content: I stayed at The Wesley in early July for 3N/4D while attending 2 HKTDC events at the Wan Chai Convention Centre. The hotel is at a fantastic location midway between Admiralty and Wan Chai MTR Stations which made commuting by the MTR very easy. The Convention Centre and other sites in Wan Chai were within short walking distances. The hotel is itself very neat, the staff is very helpful and friendly. What impressed me most is there unobtrusive customer-driven management. On the first day's stay, sometime during the night the room air-conditioning had some issues. Not finding it convenient to ask for a change of room or them looking in to the problem at that hour I simply sent an email to the Hotel email ID from the room describing the problem. By the time I was up in the morning they had another room ready and fully setup and the Manager personally assisted in the transfer to the new room. Needless to add, the new room was a fully upgraded room much bigger and definitely more expensive than the one contracted for. Definitely a hotel I am going to stay again in future.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel clean rooms.”
Reviews.Author: premierman
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Wesley on our way back from oz. Impressive lobby, good rooms cleaned very well, good location between 2 MTR stations, also taxis very plentifull + cheap. Take the open top bus tours 1 ticket covers the 3 routes, the star ferry and the peak funicular railway, don't miss the green line o t bus route which takes you around HK island, get off at stanley ( good market + beautifull beaches) also the peak is a must for fab views bus stops at funicular station. Would recomend the Wesley for short stay in HK.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable & relatively good service.”
Reviews.Author: limmatthew
Reviews.Content: My family usually stays at Wesley when they visit and it was my first time residing there. The rooms were not too big but the beds were comfortable, rooms were clean.. although it looked as though they need a little touching up on the furnish of the rooms. Generally, I was quite happy with the service the hotel provided, willingness to show directions around the area, getting a taxi and also answering questions that we asked them regarding food places.. The price of a room is quite competitive with other hotels and it is a place that holds many memories for my older relatives cos they always stay in The Wesley. It's quite funny cos this hotel in Cantonese does not sound anything like their English name. And I always have trouble directing the taxi drivers back to the hotel becos of this language confusion. So when you do stay in this hotel, remember to get their hotel name cards. A little trivia that I thought it would be useful.. for cantonese speaking tourists.

Reviews.Title: “It was OK”
Reviews.Author: Aleo2008
Reviews.Content: The service was very good. Employees were very kind. Wi-fi in the lobby and free broadband internet in the room. The room was as small as almost all the rooms available in this range of price in HK. The location is great, close to the Admiralty MTR Station.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, Good Service and reasonable Price! Best choice at Wanchai Area.”
Reviews.Author: ccylan
Reviews.Content: Located in between Wanchai station and Amiralty Station, really convenient and plenty of local food around the hotel. (Avoid the Vietnamese Restaurant right opposite the hotel, pricey and not good at all). Honestly the ladies at the front desk are not very friendly but it doesnt bother me because we dont have to deal with them much. The gentlemen at the concierge/bell boy are amazing! They are very helpful in providing tips to go around, good recommendation of restuarants and shopping. They even go to the main street to get taxi for us, cant be any more thankful! Though some reviews said the room can be noisy but we didnt have the problems at all. We booked 3 rooms and all the rooms are quiet, clean and comfortable, not spacious but good enough. Also there is direct coach from the hotel (across the street) to the airport and apparently very cheap. We took taxi because we have 2 seniors and 18 months old baby and luggages. Otherwise the coach will be a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Cold, loud and overpriced”
Reviews.Author: Kaisersoozee
Reviews.Content: I've read other reviews on this hotel. I gotta say, I arrived with very low expectations and I have a good tolerance for budget hotels. After staying two nights at the YWCA Garden View, I thought that The Wesley would have been a bit of a step up - especially when we were told that our room had been upgraded. Instead, it was a step down. We were allowed one small pillow each. We found extras on top shelf of closet. There is no heating - only a/c. Prepare to freeze and be awoken by loud neighbors shouting down the hallways. Bring a hat and bundle up on the rock hard beds. There were two complimentary bottles of water on the first night. These were not replenished on our last night. Bathroom was cramped. Everything looked outdated and worn. The location is great. Very close to the tram and MTR and convention center. I'd only recommend this place if you were traveling during the hotter months, found a good deal and don't mind loud neighbors shouting at each other down the hall.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent hotel with good location, facilities and service”
Reviews.Author: Charron
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is very convenient. The room is not that spacial, but it is of warm colours. The chairs and desks are perfectly fit. I like the colours and the western painting on the wall. It was very cold indoor at night. It seems there is no heat from the air-conditioner. I left a note to the house keeper when I was out the next day, asking for another quilt. When I was back at night, it was already there. The service was good!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel,Great location/”
Reviews.Author: acmejujubee
Reviews.Content: I may have been lucky but my room was spacious with a view and above the noise.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for the money”
Reviews.Author: bombaybeauty
Reviews.Content: Echoing most of the reviews I read before booking this hotel, the combination of location and price is good. It is central (short walk to the MTR and for that matter to most parts of the Island you might be interested in), and in a part of Wan Chai that has a lively street life (many reasonable dining options a short walk from the hotel). I was told that I was upgraded to a better room (I had booked the cheapest). My room was perfectly fine: clean, comfortable bed, wired internet access. Don't expect everything to be pristine, new, and designer; it's all a little dated, but perfectly clean. For a no-frills, great-location stay I would recommend this and certainly would repeat it myself. Hotel staff was friendly. No breakfast in the hotel (there is a Chinese restaurant), but many options nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: rgandlg
Reviews.Content: Once again a perfect stay, friendly staff and a larger room was greatly appreciated, thanks.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel is a very convenient location”
Reviews.Author: raneflight
Reviews.Content: We had arrangements to stay at the Wesley during our Hong Kong trip, since we were going to be in Hong Kong for a week, we got the special discount for staying at the Wesley for a week, the prices are listed and its cheaper than by the day rates, the only down side to it (if you require daily room service) is that they come in and clean twice during your stay. The hotel is nice, the lobby is has somewhat of a modern look to it, but there weren't a lot of sitting areas, it was just mostly empty... We stayed on the 16th (non-smoking floor). The room was rather small (sort of a corner room) but with a large window (although the view wasn't the best, we looked directly into another highrise...) The bed was ok, its a standard Asian bed that was rather hard.... but can't complain... There was only Wifi in the lobby and it was terrible, every morning we had to ask the front desk to reset the router and then staff weren't very nice about it. Also you can't eat in the lobby, the staff were very strict about it... The location of the place was really nice, it is within walking distance to the subway, supermarket, busy shopping district. Overall, this is a good place to stay, the price is not too bad for a decent hotel and it's in a great location!

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad choice”
Reviews.Author: MMWife
Reviews.Content: - great location (a few minutes walk to Admiralty) - room is fairly spacious - staff pretty helpful : offered to change my room when the air conditioning didn't work. Also came to fix the internet right away when I complained it didn't work. - for the price, I wouldn't mind staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “one of the cheapest deal if you want to stay in wanchai”
Reviews.Author: christophutaipei
Reviews.Content: i have been going to the wesley for the last 10 years or so, a few times every year, for the show at the wanchai exhibition center. the hotel has the advantage to be located in wanchai, walking distance to the exhibition center, right in the midle of the wild wanchai nightlife, conveniente to meet and entertain friends and customer on the hongkong islant. easy access to the subway, airport bus, tunnel bus ( direct to kowloon station ), chinatravel service, computer center & shopping and even a california fitness. one of the cheapest offer to get all that. the room are nice but you have to make sure to get the top floor 18+, renovated one. you have to bargain your way and ask for "business account" or some. avoid at all cost the low floor ( 4 to 8 ) where are the crapiest room and where they barn the mainland chinese tour. it is dirty, smelly and crasy noizy....

Reviews.Title: “good location but tired hotel”
Reviews.Author: Katlesh
Reviews.Content: This hotel has potential but it needs some TLC. My room was very small and tucked in at the back so the view from my window was the worst. It was grim viewing of concrete and mess. It made me want to keep my curtains closed and the room was already quite dark and dindgy. The plus side is that it is comparatively cheap compared to the rest of HK...especially given that it is so close to the hub of Wan Chai. I just went to work early and stayed in the excellent nearby bars till late so I didn't have to spend too much time in the room! It was a good room to collapse and sleep in!

Reviews.Title: “Value for money, although small bathroom and hard bed”
Reviews.Author: captivatorr
Reviews.Content: Pros - Value for money considering we booked last minute. Great location. Near Wan Chai MTR and Admiralty MTR. Near Wan Chai night spots. Clean room. Helpful front desk staff. Cons - Hard beds. Toilet is too small even for the thin me. Lobby looks elegant and spacious, but the rooms are not.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific location with good value for money”
Reviews.Author: LondonTravelbug1977
Reviews.Content: This is the second time I have stayed at the Wesley. The first being before the Hand Over in 1997. I was very impressed on both occasions, but the one thing that I would mention is that in the space of 10 years, the rooms had not been refurbished. The location is superb and the service is fantastic! Staff are only too willing to assist with local attractions and tours that are available. The hotel offers very good value for money and I would stay there again on my next trip to Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “More good than bad.”
Reviews.Author: eddy621
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Wesley during this year's Hong Kong 7's. It is very well located. The staff a reception were helpful and the rooms sizewise were ok, though the bathroom was a bit small. The downside was the bed -WOW - how hard are they. I think it's a hong kong thing as i have experienced hard beds in other hotels in hong kong, but nevertheless it was really hard. My other gripe was the noise seemed the resonate up and down the corridor because the doors seemed to allow that. Overall though, i would stay there again due to its value and location.

Reviews.Title: “Extended stay hotel or not..”
Reviews.Author: raisinette
Reviews.Content: I had recently stayed at the Wesley Hotel for 9 weeks while working in Hong Kong. The hotel lobby has been refurbished and is very lovely with contemporary and simple design. The hotel staff are very helpful with any questions we had and came to find out there is also a lovely dim sum restaurant on the second floor of the hotel! The rooms are small but have enough room to move around. I think it is comfortable for one person. The washrooms are a bit cramped. I think they need a door that can slide into the wall to save space. The beds are quite firm but they do offer extra pillows. The rooms come furnished with a mini fridge and microwave as well. I think some floors are still in the process of getting new carpet-but at the time-the 18th floor did not. This is a great budget hotel for short or long stays and have a great location for night owls that like to hang around the Wan Chai district.

Reviews.Title: “Very positive”
Reviews.Author: JP1Lichfield_England
Reviews.Content: Having read an unsympathetic review we were pleasantly surprised. The room was twin bedded and the bathroom well equipped. The air conditioning was efficient and not too fierce or noisy. The room service was excellent. The restaurant facilities were not well signposted and we prepared our own breakfast in the room (to our own satisfaction) having bought fruit etc at a supermarket nearby. The one evening meal we had in the hotel restaurant was excellent though the communication in English was not easy. The reception staff were friendly and helpful. The situation is central and convenient but the room was nevertheless quiet. The decor is good and the reception area decor interesting. The only failing was that the wardrobe was only shirt/skirt length. Overall we would happily recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and Friendly at The Wesley”
Reviews.Author: yummymummy810
Reviews.Content: My son and I stayed at The Wesley for 11 nights. We stayed in a "Run of the House" Room which was very tiny, however, comfortable for the two of us, we had a double bed, tv, airconditioning, it was quiet and the water flow from the shower was strong. Our rooms were cleaned and beds made everyday which was wonderful. We found the staff to be very helpful and friendly. The foyer is very impressive but the decor in the rooms is very dated and we couldn't get the internet to work. The location is excellent, trams and bus stops right out the front and the train station 3 mins walk away. Overall our stay was pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Good value & location. Decent room - got what you paid for”
Reviews.Author: Andre
Reviews.Content: Conferences happen quite frequently in Hong Kong, and the hotel price fluctuates greatly based on those. Comparatively, Wesley is reasonably priced for its location and you get a clean and decent room. Surely, the room is a bit small, and there are no amenities to speak off. Think about this way - when you are in Hong Kong, it's more likely you are going to be having fun outside and sitting in your room. Wesley provides you a clean and safe place to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Well positioned and good value.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Having stayed here three years ago and been mildly impressed, it was good to see that standards were still high. Centred in the Wan Chai district the hotel is excellent value for HK Island. The tram stops just outside the door and the MTR station is a 2-minute walk away. Rooms are clean and well appointed, many with microwaves and all with a fridge. Value-wise it was the best that I had found in HK and the staff work hard to ensure that everything is ok. We were able to check in at 8am after a red-eye flight from LA. From a business point of view there is no wireless internet as of Aug 04 and the business centre internet is overpriced. That said there is a great coffee shop 4 doors down with good coffee and fast wireless. The Pacific Centre is a 5 to 10 minute walk with shops and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “For travellers requiring value”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed here 4 nights on my own and was in 3 different rooms. I paid about US120.00 for the entire stay, which is a phenomenal price for the location. The Wesley is 5 minutes walk to Pacific Place. It is on the border of Wanchai with a McDonalds across the street. The tram stops right out in front which will get you to Central in just a couple of minutes. This is not where you stay on your honeymoon. Its a tall, narrow building, well worn. Although it has non-smoking floors, I got put in the smoking floors, and it smelled like smoke in the halls. Most of the rooms get a lot of road noise, despite the height. The rooms and halls are utilitarian and the walls show the effects of collisions from suitcases, etc. Most rooms are small, but the last night I was upgraded to a very large room at the end of the building, which still could not compare with even the worst room in the Oriental, Shangri-la, or Hyatt (where I frequently stay when on business). For somebody young or young at heart looking for a way to experience HK cheaply, this is very good value, especially for first timers who spend about 6 hours max in the room, and then being completely unconscious. One anecdote; When I arrived I was very thirsty and it was almost midnight. The room does not have bottled water (don't drink from the tap in HK unless you know specifically that its got its own filtering process), and it does have vending machines to buy it on some of the floors but you may end up having to go downstairs to get change, etc. In my case, when I called to ask for water, though it is not a service, one of the staff brought me 2 bottles that he paid for himself (but of course he doubled his investment with my tip). Staff are professional, helpful and take initiative but don't have a lot of resources.

HotelInfo.Name: The Wesley Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: No.22 Hennessy Road, Wanchai, Hong Kong, China
